entries.title: Arrive at Hotel Hispano
entries.address: C/ de Hortaleza, 38, 2º, Centro, 28004 Madrid, Spain
entries.content: Our flight got in very early! We headed to the hostel to drop off our stuff. Dad navigated the narrow streets on Madrid like a pro.

photos.caption: From the window in our room, looking down Calle de Hortaleza.

entries.title: Breakfast at Loreto Coffee Bar (and a nap)
entries.address: Corre. Baja de San Pablo, 6, Centro, 28004 Madrid, Spain
entries.content: No pictures here as everyone was way too tired to even take our phones. We ordered a massive slice of tortilla and Mom made her first of many comments about eating too much bread. We then headed back to the hotel for a nap.

entries.title: Gran Via
entries.content: After almost two hours of napping we started our first day into the busy streets of Madrid.

entries.title: Puerta del Sol
entries.address: Prta del Sol, s/n, Centro, 28013 Madrid, Spain
entries.content: Our first stop was the Puerta del Sol. Little did we know we were in Madrid the day before the Day of Madrid and multiple stages had been built for the celebration.

entries.title: The First Beer (of many)
entries.address: Pl. de Celenque, 1, Centro, 28013 Madrid, Spain
entries.content: We stopped for our first beer at a Cañas y Tapas, a chain tapas restaurant. In my defense, the nearby Casa Labra had a big line.

entries.title: Circling the Parroquia de San Ginés
entries.address: Pasadizo de San Ginés, 5, Centro, 28013 Madrid, Spain
entries.content: We continued on in the direction of the famous Chocolatería San Ginés.

photos.caption: Mom is going to hate this photo.

entries.title: Plaza Mayor
entries.content: We took another break in the gorgeous Plaza Mayor. Dad drank some brown, Mom had sangria that was a bit too sweet, and I had a gin & tonic. This was also one of the many times we ate croquettes.

entries.title: Mercado de San Miguel
entries.address: Pl. de San Miguel, s/n, Centro, 28005 Madrid, Spain
entries.content: A very, very quick stroll (mosh crossing) through the Mercado de San Miguel. Truly not enough space to pull out a phone so our photos are limited to Mom's shot of some pretty olives.

entries.title: Catedral de Santa María la Real de la Almudena & Palacio Real de Madrid
entries.address: Royal Palace of Madrid, Spain
entries.content: We arrived at the Palacio Real de Madrid after a short tour of the Cathedral.

entries.title: Dinner at EL miniBAR
entries.address: C/ del Mesón de Paños, 1, Centro, 28013 Madrid, Spain
entries.content: My master googling and tour guiding skills led us to an awesome tapas restaurant between the Opera house and Plaza Mayor.

entries.title: Ambrosio & A Concert in Puerta del Sol
entries.address: Calle de la Bolsa, 5, Centro, 28012 Madrid, Spain
entries.content: A bit of aimless wandering in the direction of Puerta del Sol paid off when we stopped at Ambrosio. We all loved it here, it might be our favorite bar of the trip! Great drinks, good energy, friendly staff, free raciónes.

photos.caption: The band playing was called 'Lisasinson'. They had a 90's power pop, twee rocker vibe. "Tontipop"

entries.title: Museo Nacional del Prado
entries.address: Museo Nacional del Prado, Madrid, Spain
entries.content: We woke up not so early, grabbed a quick bite to eat in Chueca, and stood in a very long line to get into the Prado. We all loved the museum; highlights were the dark Goya pieces and the room dedicated to Hieronymus Bosch.

photos.caption: I was reprimanded by the nicest security guard who simply pointed at my phone and wagged their finger.

entries.title: A stroll through Parque de El Retiro
entries.address: Parque de El Retiro, Madrid, Spain
entries.content: Jet leg plus three hours in the museum meant we were exhausted, so we took it easy and strolled through Parque de El Retiro.

entries.title: Dinner at Txirimiri Ferraz
entries.address: C. de Ferraz, 38, Moncloa - Aravaca, 28008 Madrid, Spain
entries.content: Foreshadowing our upcoming trip to the Basque country, we ended up at a Basque restaurant (not pictured). We tried our hand at navigating the Madrid Metro!

entries.title: Partying in Chueca
entries.address: C. de Gravina, 13, Centro, 28004 Madrid, Spain
entries.content: The area of Madrid we stayed in is called Chueca which is known for its nightlife. A local pointed us to a nearby bar called Escape when my mom explained we were looking for a place to dance!

photos.caption: Mom singing karaoke. The crowd went wild for 'Sweet Caroline'.

entries.title: First sign of the Basque Country!
entries.content: This pin is obviously not in the right spot, but on our long drive to San Sebastian I grabbed a photo of some of the first mountains we saw along the way.

entries.title: Plaza de la Constitucion
entries.address: Constitución Plaza, 20003 Donostia, Gipuzkoa, Spain
entries.content: Our lodging was in the old town of San Sebastian, which has the nickname of Donostia (Dono - Saint, Stia - nickname for Sebastian). This gorgeous plaza was steps away from our hotel!

entries.title: Koruko Andre Mariaren Basilika
entries.address: 31 de Agosto Kalea, 46, 20003 Donostia, Gipuzkoa, Spain
entries.content: Mom and Dad in front of a basilica right in the heart of old town.

entries.title: Overlooking the Bahía de La Concha
entries.content: After wandering through Old Town, stopping only for beer and pinxtos, we were spit out onto Mari Kalea and now overlooking the bay.

photos.caption: We didn't realize it then, but we would be eating dinner at the restaurant at the bottom of this photo later!

entries.title: Familia! Meeting up with Juanjo and Intza
entries.content: The crew part-way through our walk around Motako Gaztelua (12th century castle) on Pasealeku Berria. It was drizzling!

entries.title: Don't Jump!
entries.content: Juanjo explained that Donostia used to sustain itself on open-water fishing. The boats with the strongest, most resilient rowers would cross the Bahía de La Concha and reach a fish sighting before other boats. The race became tradition and races across the bay and back are the most anticipated events in San Sebastián!

entries.title: Dinner at Kofradia Jatetxea
entries.content: We finished with an incredible meal at a local fish restaurant. All the fish on the menu were caught that day by boats sitting in the harbor just outside.

entries.title: First Day in Gernika, More Family at Marko Pollo
entries.address: Santa Ana Auzoa, 16, 48315 Kortezubi, Bizkaia, Spain
entries.content: We arrived in Gernika and made our way to our favorite spot to eat (and Ainhoa's least favorite 😉)!

entries.title: Coffee in the mountains at LEZIKA
entries.address: Basondo Auzoa, 8, 48315 Kortezubi, Bizkaia, Spain
entries.content: We drove up the hill from Marko Pollo to drink some coffee and cerveza's. Dad and I hiked further up the mountain to check out the entrace to Santimamiñeko cave.

entries.title: Morning on Ainhoa's Patio
entries.address: Nafarroa Kalea, 22, 48300 Gernika-Lumo, Bizkaia
entries.content: Views from the back patio of Ainhoa's apartment on the outskirts of Gernika. Aitziber was actually about to move in and Ainhoa was moving into an apartment in the town center.

entries.title: Parading in the Town Center
entries.content: The children of Gernika were lining up, about to parade through the streets. They are wearing traditional Basque attire; some were even playing the txistu and tabor! Among the children was the daughter of our good friend Ruben.

entries.title: Pintxos with Íñigo, Taberna Auzokoa
entries.address: Pablo Picasso Kalea, 9, 48300 Gernika-Lumo, Bizkaia, Spain
entries.content: Íñigo is Juanjo's brother, who came to see us from Durango. We found ourselves at this Pintxo place many times. Dad also saw a restaurant up the street with Grandma's maiden name.

entries.title: Visitng Family in Abaroa
entries.content: As is tradition, we showed up un-announced to the homestead near Sukarrieta where our cousins live. Pictured are siblings Teresa and Jose Luis, the children of Filipa {idk}. It was a team effort finding the correct road and correct building from memory!

entries.title: Selfies in Mundaka
entries.content: We drove down from Abaroa and walked to the docks of Mundaka.

entries.title: Playa Laga
entries.content: We made our way to the other side of the river to check out this gorgeous beach. I think it was windy.

entries.title: Looking Across Playa Laida to Sukarrieta
entries.address: Antzora, 24, 48311 Ibarranguelua, Biscay, Spain
entries.content: Finishing a long day eating and drinking at Atxarre Taberna, another favorite spot of Ainhoa's, which looks out over the river.

title: Oviedo & Playa de las Catedrales
subtitle: May 6
linkTitle: Oviedo & Playa de las Catedrales, May 6

entries.title: Stopped for Lunch in Oviedo
entries.address: Pl. Alfonso II el Casto, 8, 33003 Oviedo, Asturias, Spain
entries.content: Ainhoa sent us off with some jamón, which we decided to eat in the charming capital city of Asturias.

entries.title: Playa de las Catedrales
entries.address: Playa de Las Catedrales, Spain
entries.content: Angel insisted we stop at this beach, and we were glad we did! Unfortunately we weren't there for low tide when you can actually walk on the beach.

entries.title: Rua, 2, Guisamo
entries.address: Rua Brea, 2, 15640 A Coruña, Spain
entries.content: Gil / Souto household in Guisamo.

entries.title: Cemitério de Guísamo
entries.address: Cemitério de Guísamo, 15640 Bergondo, A Coruña, Spain
entries.content: Visiting the grave site of our family members.

entries.title: Praia do Pedrido
entries.content: Checking out a beach at the mouth of the Rio Mandeo, the river on which The Caneiros is held.

entries.title: Puerto de Lorbe
entries.address: Puerto de Lorbe, 15177 Oleiros, A Coruña, Spain
entries.content: Next stop was Puerto de Lorbe where Angel and Uncle John used to go fishing.

entries.title: Marina Coruña
entries.content: We started our next day with a tour around A Coruña. This spot gave us a great view of the Castelo de Santo Antón. Angel believes this port is likely where the Souto's started their boat trip across the Atlantic.

entries.title: Octopus Overlook
entries.content: A view of A Coruña and the Torre de Hércules

entries.title: Torre de Hércules
entries.address: Torre de Hércules, 15002 A Coruña, Spain
entries.content: Ancient Roman lighthouse that was originally built in the 1st century!

entries.title: Praza de María Pita
entries.address: Pr. de María Pita, S/N, 15001 A Coruña, Spain
entries.content: More drinks, more croquettes, more relaxing in Galicia.

entries.title: The Chicken Farm
entries.content: Angel took us on a tour of his chicken farm. We've never seen anything like it before... 30,000 chickens!
